tool.name: Chimera.vsearch
tool.description: find potential chimeric sequences using vsearch

param.label: abskew - Abundance skew
param.help: Abundance skew is: min [ abund(parent1), abund(parent2) ] / abund(query). Default 1.9

param.label: group - Sequences Name reference
param.help: use the more abundant sequences from the same sample to check the query sequence

param.label: count - a count_table
param.help: Generated by count.seqs. When you use a count file with group info and dereplicate=T, mothur will create a count table containing seqeunces after chimeras are removed.

param.label: dereplicate - remove chimeric sequences from all groups?
param.help: If parameter is false, then if one group finds the seqeunce to be chimeric, then all groups find it to be chimeric

param.label: minh - mininum score to report chimera. Default 0.3
param.help: Values from 0.1 to 5 might be reasonable. Lower values increase sensitivity but may report more false positives.

param.label: mindiv - minimum divergence ratio
param.help: to ignore very close chimeras, increase mindiv to 1.0 or 2.0, to increase sensitivity decrease minh to 0.1. Default 0.5

param.label: xn - weight of a no vote. Default 8.0
param.help: Decreasing this weight to around 3 or 4 may give better performance on denoised data

param.label: dn - pseudo-count prior on number of no votes
param.help: Reasonable values are probably in the range from 0.2 to 2.0. Default 1.4

param.label: minimum number of differences in segment

tool.help:
@MOTHUR_OVERVIEW@
**Command Documentation**
The chimera.vsearch_ command reads a fasta file and reference file and outputs potentially chimeric sequences.
.. _chimera.vsearch: https://www.mothur.org/wiki/Chimera.vsearch
